alert.note: Alert for Fillmore; York (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 17 at 3:56AM CST until January 19 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Snow amounts ranging from 3 to 6 inches. In addition, freezing rain could produce ice accumulation up to around one tenth of an inch. Winds will average 15 to 20 MPH with gusts to around 30 MPH, initially out of the northeast but then turning northwesterly Wednesday night. * WHERE...York and Fillmore Counties. * WHEN...From late tonight through Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions may develop in time to impact the Wednesday morning commute, but there is greater confidence in impacts to the Wednesday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Please expect at least minor adjustments to later snowfall forecasts, as confidence levels in snow amounts at any given location is currently considered only medium. This is due to continued uncertainty in the exact storm track, and the location of a likely sharp transition from heavy snow to wintry mix.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
